"Unmanned" ... insufficiently descriptive.  It implies there could be a woman piloting the aircraft.  "Pilotless" is more precise.

"Airman"?  Could go either of two ways: "airman" / "airwoman" if need be, or better, "air personnel."  "Airman" is also imprecise.  Is that a male pilot?  A male flight attendant (that's what we call them now and the world didn't come to an end)?  Superman?
Reminds me of when I learned that "mailman" has been replaced by "lettercarrier".  Don't they deliver packages too ?
